p: ROS production and accumulation in the cell exerts oxidative stress, which may lead to the damage of cellular structures and eventually induce apoptosis [ 8]. Therefore, we investigated the relationship between the antifungal action of EOCs and oxidative stress in pathogens. The results are demonstrated in Figure 4. The ROS increase was 20.5 ± 7.0% in A. flavus and 14.2 ± 7.1% in A. ochraceus when treated with citral. Geraniol treatment showed a rapid increase of ROS accumulation in A. flavus and reached values of 74.2 ± 5.5%, which indicated that geraniol treatment resulted in an evident stimulation of ROS generation. There was no significant difference in ROS increase in A. ochraceus between geraniol and citral.
